newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: SIMEX Euroyen,JGBs head higher despite Nikkei rise.
newsitem.headline: SIMEX Euroyen,JGBs head higher despite Nikkei rise.

text.p: SIMEX Euroyen and Japanese government bond (JGB) futures headed higher on Wednesday as players ignored a hefty rise in Tokyo stocks and covered their short positions.
"I think Euroyen was a bit oversold. That's why there was a good squeeze up," a dealer at a U.S. commission house said. "But we still haven't broken out of either side of the range.
The benchmark March Euroyen contract stood at 98.99 at 1119 GMT after trading in a 98.93-99.02 range against an IMM close at 98.94. Volume was a moderate 15,712 lots.

Dealers said the market showed little reaction to comments by Bank of Japan governor Yasuo Matsushita that Japan's monetary policy would continue to be geared to ensuring economic recovery as he did not say anything new.
September JGBs ended at 124.89 against their previous 124.58 after hitting a high of 125.08.
"I would like to be long JGBs around 124.50 with a target of 126.00," the dealer said.
Eurodollar futures ended fractionally firmer following overnight firmness in U.S. treasuries, which were heartened by relatively tame retail data.
December Eurodollars ended at 94.050 against their IMM close at 94.040 on volume of 2,575 lots.
